books.title: The Castle of Otranto
books.author: Horace Walpole
books.summary: A Gothic tale of chivalry, romance, and horror.

books.title: The Black Arrow
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: During the War of the Roses, a young knight must rescue his lady and find out who killed his father.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Road to Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl takes a passerby down the road near her farm when they find themselves transported to another land.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: The Tempest
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A magic-induced tempest shipwrecks the king of Naples and his crew on an island inhabited by the usurped duke of Milan.

books.title: The Shaving of Shagpat
books.author: George Meredith
books.summary: A Persian barber embarks on a quest to save a city from the clutches of a tyrant and his magical hair.

books.title: The Slaves of Paris
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A group of blackmailers play a long game on several families.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.

books.title: The Box Office Murders
books.author: Freeman Wills Crofts
books.summary: The discovery of a drowned woman sets the police on the trail of a mysterious scam involving cinema cashiers.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: Discourses
books.author: Epictetus
books.summary: Epictetus instructs his students how to live the life of a Stoic.

books.title: A Cycle of the West
books.author: John G. Neihardt
books.summary: A series of epic poems that recounts the history, legends, and mythology of the American West.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Little Fuzzy
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: On a planet being exploited for its resources, the discovery of a possibly-sentient native species creates consternation and conflict.

books.title: Mr. Mulliner Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the eccentric (and hilarious) Mr. Mulliner, who regales the patrons of the Anglers’ Rest with tales of his colorful and amusing relatives.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
